column4: Well. I'm back. Not even 5 minutes gone and I have another question. How do I dual-boot WIndowsXP if I have Ubuntu installed already? All guides I see are if I have Windows installed first.
after you install xp, you'll need to pop a live cd in and recover grub
check out the first link ubotu spat out
Yeah but will my Ubutu partition be touched?
So...partitioning this section. How do I go about?
Yeah the section for WindowsXP. I need an empty partition, right? How do I go about partitioning it?
i'd use gparted, if you have it. preferrably the live cd version (which you can find by googling, easily).
I have gparted, but I'm not sure if it's the LiveCD version.
the live CD version of gparted is... just gparted on a cd. nothing else.
Ah then, no, I don't have the LiveCD version. And since I am currently out of empty CD-Rs, I probably won't be obtaining it soon.
ok, no biggie. if youre not using a ubuntu live CD, pop one in and you can run gparted from that.
I jsut realized the dilemma I am in. In order to partition this drive I need to unmount it, and in doing so, will shut down Linux, yes?
I have 4 Ubuntu Feisty LiveCDs. gparted is on them?
Okay well I'll go for it some other day then. Right now I'm busy.
Flannel, Jordan_U, ntbnnt, astro76: Much thanks, all of you! You're all great!
